summary: Two men charged in the death of a Chicago teen who performed at an inauguration event. Carnival Triumph cruise ship being towed to Mobile, AL after experiencing a fire in the engine room. Speculation arises about the possibility of the next pope being from Africa or Latin America.
Mohammed Bouazizi, a 26-year-old unemployed fruit stand owner in Tunisia, set himself on fire after a policewoman confiscated his unlicensed produce stand. This act sparked the Jasmine Revolution.
The Jasmine Revolution in Tunisia led to the ousting of President Zine el-Abidine Ben Ali, ending his 23-year reign and forcing him into exile.
Mass protests began in Egypt against President Hosni Mubarak's regime, marking a significant moment in the Arab world's pro-democracy movements.
The Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt urged its followers to protest after Friday prayers, marking the first time in the latest wave of unrest that the group has made such a call.
